alert.note: Alert for Kershaw; Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 3:17PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Lexington, central Richland and southwestern Kershaw Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 317 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Villages at Sandhill to Columbia Metro Airport. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Springdale, St. Andrews, Red Bank, Dentsville, Oak Grove, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, Arcadia Lakes, Villages at Sandhill, Columbia International University, Elgin, Killian, Riverbanks Zoo and SC State Farmer`s Market. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 50 and 102. Interstate 26 between mile markers 104 and 119. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
